dialog.title: Create Set with AI
dialog.intro: Pick the prompt matching your goal (Flashcards or Quizzes) and copy it to your AI.
dialog.prompt_guide:
- **[Anki](https://apps.ankiweb.net/)**: Top choice. Best for formulas & complex cards.
- **[Kahoot](https://kahoot.com)**: Tuned for Kahoot limits (text length, time).
- **[arsnova.click](https://arsnova.click)**: Optimized for the uni tool (Markdown, LaTeX).
dialog.upload_warning: âš ï¸ Max 30 questions & 5 MB allowed.

dialog.uploader_help: Must match format. Max 30 questions, max 5 MB.
dialog.alternative_caption: Paste the JSON output from your AI here.

audit_logging.events_list:
- ğŸ” Admin login (successful/failed)
- ğŸ—‘ï¸ Delete user results
- âš ï¸ Global data deletion
- ğŸ“¥ CSV export
- ğŸš« Login blocks (rate limiting)
audit_logging.info_list:
- Timestamp (ISO 8601)
- User ID (pseudonym)
- Action type
- Success status
- Details (e.g., deleted user)
- IP address (if available)
audit_logging.benefits:
- âœ… **Security:** Traceability during incidents
- âœ… **Compliance:** GDPR audit trail
- âœ… **Forensics:** Analysis of accesses
- âœ… **Transparency:** Admin activities documented
audit_logging.privacy_details:
**Retention:** Logs are automatically deleted after 90 days.
**Access:** Only admin users can view logs.
**Export:** CSV export possible for external archiving.

metrics_glossary.answers: **Answers**: Total number of answers given for this question.
metrics_glossary.correct_percentage: **Correct (%)**: Percentage of correct answers (difficulty index ). A value close to 100% means an easy question, a value close to 0% means a difficult question.
metrics_glossary.discrimination: **Discrimination (r_it)**: Correlation between correctly answering this question and the overall test result.
metrics_glossary.discrimination_high: : The question discriminates well between strong and weak participants.
metrics_glossary.discrimination_low: : The question discriminates poorly. It may be confusing, too easy/difficult, or have an error in the answer.

prompts.general_description: Use this prompt in ChatGPT, Claude or any other LLM to create a new `questions_*.json` set suitable for this app. Copy the text, answer the questions step by step and save the generated file afterwards in the `data/` directory.
prompts.general_best_results: Currently we achieve the best results with Â»ChatGPT 5 Thinking ComprehensiveÂ« and Â»Gemini 2.5 FlashÂ« â€“ please try these first.
prompts.kahoot_description: This prompt is specifically optimized for Kahoot. It ensures that all question texts and answer options comply with Kahoot's limits. Use it for teams who want to implement questions from your course content as a live Kahoot.
prompts.arsnova_description: This prompt guides you step by step to a question set that automatically takes into account all arsnova.click restrictions (options â‰¤ 60 characters, timer 60s, no heading markup). Use it for imports into arsnova.click.

session_saved.leaderboard: ğŸ‰ Congrats {user}! You made the leaderboard ({score} pts)!
session_saved.saved_not_on_leaderboard: Result for "{user}" saved, but not on leaderboard because {reason}.
session_saved.reason_too_short: Too fast. Allowed: {recommended_minutes} min (min for rank: {min_duration} min)

cognition_radar.explanation_short:
Radar shows correct % per cognitive stage (Bloom).

Patterns:
â€¢ Cramming (Spike at Reproduction): Good memory, weak application â†’ Practice transfer.
â€¢ Surface: Concepts known, usage fails â†’ Use case studies.
â€¢ Practical: Good app, theory gaps â†’ Refresh basics.
â€¢ Analytical: Strong solver, basic gaps â†’ Review fundamentals.
â€¢ Balanced: Solid all-rounder â†’ Keep it up!

info.early_finish: Finished {early_delta} min early. Time: {duration_display}. Limit ({tempo_label}): {allowed_min} min

summary_view.performance_explanation_content:
- Bars = points per topic (%).
- Brackets: (answered / total questions).
- Few questions = less statistical significance.
summary_view.performance_no_data_info: Not enough data for topic analysis.

cognition_radar.name: Cognitive Stages
cognition_radar.explanation_content:
- Shows points per cognitive stage (Bloom).
- Value = Achieved / Max points per stage.

Patterns & Tips:

â€¢ Crammer (Spike at Reproduction):
  - High rote memory, low transfer.
  - Tip: Do more application tasks.

â€¢ Theorist (High Reproduction):
  - Knows concepts, struggles to apply.
  - Tip: Try case studies.

â€¢ Practitioner (High Application):
  - Good usage, theory gaps.
  - Tip: Refresh basics.

â€¢ Analyst (High Analysis):
  - Good problem solver, foundation gaps.
  - Tip: Consolidate fundamentals.

â€¢ Balanced:
  - Solid competence.
  - Tip: Keep it up!

â€¢ Zigzag:
  - Inconsistent.
  - Tip: Find specific gaps per topic.

Note: Requires sufficient questions to be reliable.
